decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - With appropriate safeguarding conditions, the proposed extensions and alterations, due to their design, appearance and relative position to adjoining properties, would be compatible with the character and appearance of the property and the street scene, would not harm neighbours' living conditions and would not result in conditions prejudicial to highway safety. The proposal would therefore accord with adopted Unitary Development Plan policies ENV-B.1.1 (New Development), H.6.4 (Extensions and Alterations), T.1.4 (Car and Cycle Parking and Servicing for Developments) and the objectives of the Council's Residential Extension Guidelines.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extensions hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.

Condition : 4 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 5 - Before the development is commenced, the existing crossover shall be enlarged to 3.6m wide and the off-street parking accommodation for two vehicles, soft landscaping and alterations to front boundary wall of no greater than 0.6m height, as shown on drawing number JUL/30/05 REV B shall be provided and permanently retained thereafter.
Condition : 6 - The extensions hereby permitted shall not be occupied at any time other than for purposes ancillary to the residential use of the dwelling known as 23 Blosson Waye.
Condition : 7 - No additional flank windows or other glazed openings shall be formed in any wall of the extensions hereby approved without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 8 - The roof area of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area without the grant of further specific permission from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 9 - A splay of 2.4m x 2.4m shall be provided on each side of the access, the depth measured from the back of the footway and the widths outwards from the edges of the access, and no fence, wall or other obstruction to visibility exceeding 0.6m in height above the surface of the adjoining highway shall be erected within the areas of such splays.
Condition : 10 - The front boundary wall shall be altered and retained as shown on drawing number JUL/30/05 REV B, at a height of no greater than 0.6m and shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Condition : 11 - Before the development hereby permitted commences the applicant must either:

a.	Investigate the site for landfill gas to the satisfaction of the LPA, to ascertain whether gas protection measures are required.  Where measures are required the details shall be submitted to, and approved by, the LPA.Or

;b.	The applicant shall install gas protection measures as a precautionary measure without first investigating the site.  The details of these measures shall be submitted to, and approved by, the LPA

.c.	For a. and b. all required measures shall be installed before the development is first occupied.
description: Erection of a two-storey side extension, single-storey rear extension, front porch and conversion of garage to habitable room
